q: chief executive in a surprising management reshuffling announced with the Internet company's fourth-quarter earnings, which jumped 29%. The Mountain View, Calif., company said the moves, effective April 4, were made to streamline decision-making and create clearer lines of responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. Eric Schmidt will no longer be responsible for the day-to-day operations. Instead, he will become exective chairman, focusing on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. in exchange for Simon Cowell continuing with American Idol, Pop Idol would be pulled off the air, conceding the United Kingdom entirely to The X Factor. London's Independent newspaper quoted one senior music executive as saying, It has come out 75/25 in favor of Simon Cowell . He is the star. He had all the aces. But there was a catch, and a very big one indeed. In exchange for winning the airwaves in the United Kingdom, Simon Cowell forfeited his dream of bringing The X Factor to the United States.
